tasks_and_functions.title: Tasks and Functions
tasks_and_functions.description: The following are the priority areas of activity of the Department of Higher Education, Science and Innovation: - Implementing a unified state policy in the fields of higher education, science, and innovation in the region, as well as coordinating strategic development directions; - Coordinating activities in the field of providing secondary special, vocational, and higher education services, as well as organizing professional development and retraining of personnel; - Ensuring the quality of education in secondary special, vocational, and higher educational institutions according to international standards, organizing the educational process, and developing the professional skills of management and pedagogical staff of educational institutions; - Strengthening the moral and ethical content of secondary special, vocational, and higher education, and fostering patriotism in youth based on the ideas of independence, respect for national values, humanism, and high moral ideals; - Increasing the efficiency of scientific research, coordinating the implementation of state scientific and innovation programs, and ensuring integration between education, science, and production; - Establishing international relations to implement joint educational and scientific programs in the fields of secondary special, vocational, higher, and postgraduate education, science, and innovation; - Strengthening the integration of education, science, and production, commercializing new developments, promoting innovative activity, and developing the startup ecosystem in cooperation with relevant agencies and departments under the ministry.

investment.title: Direct Foreign Investment Projects
investment.content: According to the decision No. 548/39 of the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated September 7, 2024, 'On measures for the implementation of the investment program for the third quarter of 2024,' direct investment projects involving international donor organizations with a total value of $16.4 million are planned to be implemented in the third quarter of 2024 to strengthen the material and technical base of higher educational institutions. Within the framework of these projects involving international donors, $16.4 million (100% of the plan) was utilized during July-September 2024.
